TL;DR 

-HUGE open ended levels with extreme amounts of detail and quirks that change based on time of day.
-Great soundtrack
-Huge variety in customization
-"Go-at-your-own-pace" gameplay
-A living, breathing nature with life cycles
-Optional material grinding
-Optional but extremely detailed and rewarding exploration
-Lots of lore you can unlock in-game by exploring
-Drop in drop out coop, with optional passwords and integrated steam invite
-The cutest companion in gaming history, that you customize along with yourself
-If it moves, you can hunt it or catch it

This game is really therapeutic by yourself.

If i were to compare this game to other games, i would draw parallels between the mission system of Metal Gear Solid V, the worlds of Horizon: Zero dawn and Zelda: Breath of the wild and the combat and world building of Dragon's dogma.

The level of detail is absurd, unfortunately it will only be noticed by the people that care to look. Basically - if you can see it move, you can capture and study it. This applies to everything from giant dragons to birds to even ants and tiny fish swimming in schools. There are even creatures and critters that only appear at certain times of the day!

While in-game movement can at times feel clunky, i haven't encountered anything that severely detracts from the experience or is in any way game breaking. Setup with a controller (which is absolutely recommended to play) can be a little confusing at first, so here's how to disable Steam Big Picture mode so you can use the regular steam overlay while you play.

Go to Steam in the top left corner of the steam client > Settings > In-game > Untick "Use the big picture overlay when using a steam input enabled controller".

I also suggest disabling motion blur and V-sync in advanced graphics settings if you are playing on a high definition monitor. 

Now tech advice aside, once you start the game you are given language options. Scroll through the list of SPOKEN LANGUAGES and change it either to "Monster Hunter Language" or "Japanese" for the best experience, both with dialogue and cutscenes. It DOES have a dub (that most certainly doesnt seem low quality at all) but the lip sync seems to be aligned to either Japanese or Monster Hunter Language, and like any originally japan-exclusive franchise the game has exaggerated animesque body language and expressions.

Is my review missing something? Suggest in the comments.

Całkiem niezłe MMO jak sie juz człowiek przyzwyczaii do zupełnie nieintuicyjnego UI i zainstaluje kilka addonow zeby wogole było cokolwiek wiadomo z tego co się ma w ekwipunku albo jakie buffy/debuffy ma się na sobie albo na targecie. Sterowanie postaci może powodowac palpitacje u ludzi przyzwyczajonych do innych mmo (WoW, TSW, FF14 itp) ale to tez jest do przebolenia i przyzwyczajenia. To co boli to fakt ze bez premium membera sie prawie nie da grać ze względu na miejsce w plecaku i brak osobnej paczki na maty. tez to mozna przebolec. Ale to czego nie mozna przebolec to ciagłe crashe, ciagle "login timeouty" i to zaraz po maintance ktory swoja droga jest juz 3-4 w ciagu jednego tygodnia. I nie mowa tu o krotkich 15-30 minutowych "serwer down" Takie 8-10 godzinny maintance, ktore poza kolejnymi crashami i timeoutami nie daja kompletnie nic. Im wiecej nad ta gra pracuja tym bardziej sie pierniczy. Ze juz nie wspomne ze serwery EU maja Serwer down w godzinach tych samych co serwery NA czyli na nasz europejski czas od oklo 9 do 17. 

Podsumowujac. Jednak minus gdyz gra sie dobrze i po wprawieniu nawet calkiem przyjemnie (nawet poronione skakanie miedzy paskami skili da sie jakos normalnie ogarnac) ale ta niestabilnosc i chore godziny "prac nad gra" i jak ze cholernie czeste (no korcze rozumiem raz na tydzien ale nie codziennie albo co drugi dzien) "prace nad gra" sa poprostu deprymujace. 

Dzisiejszy dzien poprostu czare goryczy u mnie przelał. Wkońcu urlop, moge sie spokojnie zrelaksowac a tu dupa bo gra ponowinie nie dziala 4 raz w tym tygodniu a jak juz o 17 wlaczyli serwery to nie pograsz bo login "time out" a na stronie lakoniczny przekaz ze wiedza ze gracze steam maja problemy z logowaniem i staraja sie to rozwiazac... no korcze ale to nie dzis ten problem sie pojawil tylko juz wczesniej i do cholery kompletnie nic z tym nie jest robione. jeszcze wiecej game crashy i to na instach w walce, poza walka, a czasami sie zdazaly nawet jak zostawilem postac i poszedlem zrobic kanapki i tak przy nieruchomym patrzeniu w przestrzen gra sie ot tak poprostu skaszaniła. Najlepsze przyszło 3 min potem jak probowalem zalogowac ponownie gdyż pojawil sie "login timeout" i pograne. A maintance sie skonczyl 2h wczesniej...  

Przepraszam za orto i polinglish...

This is an elaborated and well made game. It's like a board game with strategy battles as well. I love the game mechanics and variety of units and many other stuff. I highly recommend this game.

The only thing I don't like is expensive DLC's and the fact that the DLC's are already included in-game, but you cannot use it until you pay for it. Maybe just wait for the sales or whatever.

I was gifted this game by my friend JohnnyZhu. Otherwise i would've never bought it as strategy games are NOT my forté.

I have really mixed feelings about the game. On one hand, combat is excellent and the strategy gameplay is great, even to a hopeless beginner like myself. The game is a lot of fun as long as i avoid the battles which are hopeless overwhelming to someone like me - players accustomed to Total War will probably love it as there is WAY more strategic depth to this than "normal" strategy games, due to the fantasy theme and wide variety of unique races and units. As combat is not limited to humans and whatever combat styles they can come up with, there are many more ways to play battles that is most likely unthinkable in games like Rome. 

Unfortunately, if you do not already own Total War Warhammer 1 you'll be missing out on over half the game. Warhammer 2 feels like a large expansion pack, as over 70% of the game's content is locked. You need various DLCs to access this content, and MOST OF IT is part of the first game. The games are linked together - if you have Warhammer 1, you get access to all its default factions (and whatever dlcs you may own) as well as the second of the two game modes in the game - the by far largest one, as it contains the entire world map of the first game and combines it with most of the world map of the second game. (Although not the entire map from WH2, for whatever reason?) This means most of the game is stuck behind a pay wall - you must cough up nearly twice the price of the game itself to gain access to all its features and game modes.

If you already have Total War: Warhammer 1 (or family share libraries with somebody that does) this is an excellent game for both casual players (like myself, barely scraping by on the easiest difficulty) and the Mortal empires campaign (the one from the first game) is excellent, especially with a friend. 

Even i am having fun with this game (provided i let my friend control battles because it is frankly so overwhelming i get headaches when i choose to take part in the fighting myself, and that's coming from someone that used to gladly spend 20+ hours grinding it out in games like Call of Duty and League of Legends. Those games are like elementary multiplication compared to the mental gymnastics required to comprehend and micro manage everything going on in this messy soup of fantasy warfare)

The game features an incredibly fun item system and leveling / skill tree for heroes and lords similar to typical RPGS (and the Vermintide games) and this adds a ton of flavour to the game - it actually makes you want to fight the combat yourself, despite how horribly stressful it is. There are tons of voice line interactions between units and characters as well, not to mention unique animations for most unit types fighting each other.

One saving grace is that the developers occasionally release new lords or factions as free dlc, and you can use the free dlc from the previous game without having the previous game installed.

Get it on a sale. Do not buy it at full price unless you already own the first game, as you'll be missing out on over half the content.

It is clearly better than the first one that I wouldn't recommend that much. 

Improvements over the first one: 
- 8 different lords with really 8 different experiences
- higher variety in maps and features.
- much bigger campaign map with much more things to do and more to conquer
- the scenario allows for more freedom, less constraints and less static experience for a more old style total war conquests.
- much nicer graphics.
- a lot of factions to make war with. In fact you'll face all factions present in TWWH1 + the new ones.

Steps back:
- loading times severely increased. I believe the game doesn't like at all Ryzen because despite high clocked CPU, RAM and the game on a nvme drive the loading times for battle to campaign take about 1m and a half, which is insane.

There are still some stupid mechanism like enemies retreating to your stronghold during sieges or ridiculous armies with one lord and no troops sieging a city, hopelessly but still cutting you from the ability to build or recruit in that settlement.

On the top of that there are still some features missing, like the lack of bridges (but CA said they'll release them for the merged campaign), proper diplomacy, proper economic features, a more clever IA, but all in all, nothing to worry about. Clearly a go for game!

The most realistic and relaxing city building simulator out there. Absolutely spectacular. My only issue is there is a lot of DLC and I can't seem to find a season pass. If you want DLC, I recommend Mass Transit and Green Cities, as they are the most useful and most mods on the workshop require those. The rest is up to preference.

Recieved as a christmas present from Vasura / Indraw.

I had low, low expectations after Unity and Syndicate. Frankly, i'd been avoiding the game because i was scared of being disappointed again.

I was so wrong. AC 4 Black flag meets Lord of the Rings: Shadow of War. That's the best way i can describe the gameplay in this game. It feels good, it looks great and it sounds amazing.

I'd forgotten what an experience a true assassin's creed game can really be. I recommend this a lot, both if you enjoy older Assassin's creed games AND if you enjoy the shadow of mordor/war games. You can play this one like either.

This game is fantastic. At least on the highest difficulty, with enemy scaling on. Of course not everyone likes playing it super hardcore.

It looks absolutely gorgeous. Especially the underwater areas are breath taking. (I'm not sorry.)

The AI has been massively improved from earlier titles - guards frequently roam the map and do not seem to always have rigid "tether" distances - once they go searching for you, they can follow you across the entire fucking world if you fail to shake them off. They will also alternate with shifts - especially noticeable in larger forts or bases, where they will slowly rotate around the entire area. This means it can be quite hard to "clear out" a part of a fortress, as new guards may rotate from another side of the place, or others may arrive on horseback from their regular patrols.

If this is the new standard for assassin's creed, i am definitely a fan again. This is what all action RPGs should aspire to be like.

I should mention i've actively avoided all DLC and in-game store items. I'm a purist when it comes to RPGs and only use what i actually find or pick up during gameplay. Fortunately the game lets you hide DLC items.

I am a huge AC fan right from the beginning and a new AC game always excites fans no matter how it turns out. However, with respect to general perspective, the series really went downhill after Black Flag, it somewhere lost the spark but with AC Origins, I guarantee you, you will get those good old days vibe with current generation environment texture and graphics ! This game is a masterpiece and deserves to be spent hours with.

I really enjoyed this game.  Maybe it was the time between games.  I'm not sure but the past 3 or 4 AC games ahve been a little staleto me.  Even though this included less stealthy assassin techniques than the previous ones, I think the environment and historical significance was really good.  Also, the person in the animus meant something which is more than can be said since Desmond.  Definitely worth a look.

Between the miasma of Space Grand Strategy games that flood steam, Stellaris is the pearl to get and nurture for hundreds hours.

Not only it nails a pretty perfect balance between CHALLANGE - PLAYABILITY - FUN, but it's also a fresh take on a genre that felt decayed in an ocean of crap titles that at best were able to remake old mechanics with a new skin.

Paradox games are known to be pretty difficult and also have a crap tutorial that doesn't really explain you the crapton of menus, and this is why I've never been a Paradox fan. I didn't want to study hundred pages of guides to understand how it works. This time tough, the tutorial is really well made, doesn't flood you with a tons of info in 10 minutes, and accompanies you while you have FUN playing the game.

We are on the difficult side here, you will be kicked in the balls several times before developing a succesfull empire, but this time the learning process is fun, and if you are looking of a Space Grand Strategy Game, look no further, Stellaris is THE ONE.

18h isn't much for a Paradox game. And that says everything... I'm not very willing to start a new game. Why?

I wouldn't recommend it for the moment, nor say people "don't buy it".

I personally find it much better than other Galactic 4x (endless space and Galactic Civilizations), so it deserves a thumb up, however it is far below other Paradox games, so it would deserve a thumb down.

As tons of people say the early game is awesome. The mid game is boring, if you get lucky enough to reach it. On my last playthrough, in Hard difficulty, everything was going fine. I was on track with other empires. Had some grand strategic movements in mind. A good army on par with others, with about 10 platform defense on the most important points of my Empire.

Good! Good!!

And then... A Fallen Empire declares war. That is something really bad for game balancing as they are completely overpowered compared to other Empires. The guy declares war for forcing me to abandon half of my Empire and sends me a 80K army in my face. I have 5K... And you can't expect to have much much more after 4 hours gameplay.

Game ruined... Have to start another game... Com'on... I play in Very hard since the first Hearts of Iron. I'm playing Ironman in Crusader Kings 2 where I'm twice Emperor and I can't even count how many Realms I have. I'm far from being a newbie in Paradox Games.

Such punitive events cannot happen in a Paradox Game. It would by like if in Hears of Iron you're playing Germany and you have a chance out of x that in 1938 just after the Anschluss EVERYONE declares a war on you (Russia, USA, Japan, France, UK, Poland, Tchekoslovakia, Italy, Switzerland, Norway, Sweden, Holland...). You can be as strong as you want, you just can't stand such things...


Apart from this kind of stuff the game is well done. Ultra stable. No bugs (for me at least). Very well polished. UI is great. But it feels so empty compared to others Paradox Game.

Don't get me wrong, it's much better than all others 4X / Grand strategy games, but Paradox kind of used me (us) to much better...

Superficial diplomacy. Non existent politics (Ministers? Parties? Government policies like drafting, economy scale, education etc in HOI?). Non existent economy / war economy (convoys? supply to troops (something like that...)). Personalities traits? I don't expect something as deep as Crusader Kings, but com'on... Each Character has 1 trait... No relation effect..

I mean... Paradox seems to me very lazy on this game.

I'm sure they will turn out to be a HUGE game within some years, but at this point... It is sooooooooo below other Paradox games. It's way below day 1 Crusader Kings. I'm a bit disappointed. But yet, it's a good compared to competition

Although I've put many hours in this game and probably will again, I don't recommend this game as much as I would like to.

There are a few requirements if you want to like this game :
- Be patient. An update of between 400Mb - 10Gb (rarely that big) will come out every few days. It's okay when you have fast speed internet and a good processor...for other games. This one will cut the download in many parts and between each there will be a sort of processing time to install part of the update. I don't know how tf the devs decided to deploy their updates, but it's the only game or even software I've seen doing this. And I'm a software developer myself.

In a non-dedicated host session:
- Be persevering. When you want to play with friends on a non-dedicated session, prepare to swear. Joining your game will be a pain. Me and my girlfriend wasted a few nights when it just didn't want to work. The other times it takes a few tries and/or game restarts.
- Be coordinated. When you finally manage to play with your friends on a non-dedicated session, increase the max-tethering distance or your friends will keep spawning next to you if you go too far from them, and that can cause other problems like having one of them tending the garden in your base teleported over a pit of lava. Also you can't go inside a dungeon or cave alone: all of your friends will be teleported inside with you, ready or not. Hell even if you go high above such a dungeon/cave, the game will think you're inside because it thinks in x,y coordinates and teleport your friends mid-air falling to their deaths.

In a dedicated host session:
- Be sure to leave enough food for your dinos for them not to starve to death when you leave the server on and no one's online. But anyway that's a common point to all dedicated server games.

Other than that, one of my favorite crafting/building/survival games. And I'm very picky about them.

In regards to update v256:

I've been through two flyer nerfs and this one just takes the cake for being garbage.  Massive maps and no way to get anywhere fast.  If you die you can basically kiss your body and gear goodbye cause you'll never get back there in time.   

Also reducing the vault size out of knowhere is a pretty jerk move.  Especially when its the baseline for advanced base building.  I mean come on, interiors and exteriors of the buildings are just totally messed up now.  I love the idea of smallers vaults but jeez, let us at least pick them up and move them around so we can re-organize our bases.

Loved the game until now.  Give us at least 200% speed and normal pre 256 update stamina.

Bought because of a rec from a friend who's put tons of hours in before I even purchased it. Its so much fun, but you do have to put in some hard work to get to a more versitile realm of the game. Playing with a friend is great! It is their own server but I'd call it multiplayer. At this point I think Ive put in over 200 hours which I didnt think would happen! Exploring the maps has and contiued to hold my interes to keep coming back even though on my computer I had to lower resolution quite a bit. I miss it if I go too long without playing! lol 
Does take up quite a bit of space, often takes a while to load and can be laggy at time, but as it stands it is an early access game. 
Havent bought/played the scortched earth expansion, and probably wont until the base game is complete but a 3rd map is great with me! 
Anyway! Its fun, immersive, huge and worth the time in my opinion.

This game got a lot of developers love and finally deserves a thumb up, so I'm editing my review.

After 3 patches the size of big DLCs, given for free, finally the game has a scope and now it's fun.

There are several game modes where you can customize how much a grindy and survavival experience you want, including an option that nullifies grind completly.

But mostly now there's a good storyline, factions, and things to do after you have enstabilished a foothold in the galaxy. Base building, freighters, ground vehicles, a meaningfull trading system.

A decent map let's you backtrack to previously visited planets and enstabilish trade routes, giving you a place in the galaxy and a direction.

So no more grinding a planet after another for the sake of it in a bubble of stars without waypoints and references.

Multiplayer functionalities are still limited but the devs seem to be working on it.

Now I can suggest the purchase even at full price.

Hot take, but this is my favorite video game of all time. I think it gets much more flack than it deserves and it is actually very fun. Even though it's not as great as New Vegas, it is still fantastic in its own way, and the DLC is just spectacular (Except Wasteland and Contraptions Workshop, which are average at worst). The world space is beautiful, and the story... well an attempt was made. Overall, if you ever find the GOTY edition on sale, pick it up and at least give it a shot. Mods really enhance the experience as well, and the modding community for this game is colossal. Personal mod recommendations include Hot Diggity Perk Overhaul, Sim Settlements 2, Vivid Fallout, and Darker Nights. So grab your Laser Rifle, get your dog, and go explore the ruins of the Commonwealth (Mind the ghouls).

I've read a lot of negative reviews of this game on steam for various reasons, but for me it's been great. I'm a big fan of ds1/ds2 and I absolutely love this game. Granted, there are a few changes that I may not have immediately become a big fan of (multiple invasions) but soon enough I loved the game even more for it. The game feels fluid and refined, weapons are fun to use, parrying feels good, the buffs work great (a big fan of bleed). Password system is amazing for coop. Fight clubs are great fun. Graphics looks amazing on max with a steady 60 fps all the time even in the notorious swamp area.

Only issue I had was when I first started playing I had a crash with the first bonfire. But I persisted, didn't turn down any settings. I guess I got lucky and was able to continue, but since then I have had no crash at all. No installation issues. Nothing. Just loving the game. Anyone into this kind of stuff needs to try it. Will not regret.

Absorbing game, very immersive with astonishing graphics. I got in love with those small details like hairworks, impact on enviroment (e.g. steps in the snow) or moving equipment on Lara. Lack of HUD during casual gameplay gets you into roleplaying really fast. Story is also interesting, with a surprising plot-twist. The side missions are not annoying and will give you nice reward, together with the challenges, that are not unachievable, like in other games. Solid 20 hours of gameplay, if you follow the story, do some challenges, all side missions and all the tombs.

[b]I give this game 85%[/b]

The reason is that there are some unnecessary flaws that just degrades the overal experience. Of course that some of the game mechanics are not possible in real life, but are acceptable for the general thought and story of the game (like ledge jumping, rope arrows or immortal warriors). But making a game like this, not paying attention to basic details is really unnecessary. This is the list of things that really grind my gears to be in a great game like this:

- The well founded private militia uses AK-47's.
 [i] (Maybe it's just that their budget went for the winter jackets, but who knows?). [/i]

- Oh, an old tomb full of ancient relics and stuff.[b] Better destroy it[/b].

- The native Russian locals speak perfect American English.
[i] (Come on, Russian accent would do just perfectly). [/i]

- Speaking of languages, who can learn ancient languages on the go by reading murals and propaganda leaflets?

- Combat is horrible (if you go noisy, the stealth part is great)

Now those things might seem petty for some of you, but then again, I give this game a pretty high score and that is why I am looking for small things. But those aren't actually small things, it's details you are just forced to ignore. As I said, those things are still acceptable for the story, but they can be overcum (past tense of ovecome, right?).

Also, I don't care that the story is straightfoward without any means of changing the end. Which is unusual for today's game industry. They did it, they made a great story.

This game is amazing, it doesn't just focus on street racing but on other aspects of racing, such as Rally Cross, Aero racing, water races, hovercrafts, motorsports (Racing on tracks, Airplane races, etc.), and even freestyle such as Demolition Derby, stunts, and all that. It also has a various selection of vehicles branding from a typical Lamborghini to a Swedish Koenigsegg, and a typical Nissan GT-R to a KTM X-Bow R. The game is great and all but it has some down sides, such as everything is expensive. The Story line is decent but thats not the game is entirely about, the game is about owning your vehicle and customizing it, driving it like you've "seen no red light", and all that. And yes, I got this from only playing 44 hours of the game. (Not paid to say all this btw)

app_name: Total War: ROME II - Emperor Edition
review: Sono ormai un fedelissimo della saga Total War, posso dire che nonostante i primi problemi dovuti ai Bug, questo gioco è ben curato e soprattutto grazie all'ambientazione (Che io amo) fa perdere ore e ore nel tentativo di conquistare il mondo antico. La Grafica per lo stile di gioco è meravigliosa, arricchita poi dalle molte MOD disponibili grazie agli sviluppatori nel Workshop. Le meccaniche di gioco sono state migliorate, con un IA che delle volte (ad alti livelli di difficoltà) mette serimanete in gioco le abilità strategiche del Player che la sta affrontando. Sono felice di giocare a Rome II, l'unica pecca che ho riscontrato, come tutti credo è l'assenza dell'innovazione che era avvenuta un Shogun II, del multiplayer ...Un vero peccato sotto quell'aspetto, avrebbe reso il gioco praticamente perfetto!

There's a lot to like about this game.  'Mech designs are detailed.  Missions are more varied than I expected and can easily throw a curveball.  There's an emphasis on "natural consequences" and learning as you play.  The salvage system (getting "thirds" of a mech until you accumulate 3 pieces to complete it) takes some getting used to, but I'm starting to appreciate.

The starmap (interstellar navigation) is mediocre at best.  For something that's crucial to gameplay, there's no tutorial or suggestions, and I haven't found a search system yet.  And the starmap is quite large.  I doubt I'll ever go to 10% of these systems, because travel is **expensive** and there's not that much difference from Point A and Point B.  Factions: what does it matter, really?  I have no loyalty.  Black market: as if I can afford those prices.

Story... well, fortunately the story doesn't intrude much.  It's not bad in anyway.  It's just... I'm a mercenary 'Mech commander.  "Story" is not my motivation, y'know?  Money and metal.

The Experience system is okay.  Pilots only gain experience for kills, so a pilot that 3/4 destroys an enemy with a horrific missile volley gets nothing for it.  Juggling isn't difficult, but I'm not enthusiastic about it.

System specs are nice and low.  My older machine still starts whining about the game at times; it would be nice if there were more things to turn off, like environmental graphics.

Haven't had any crashes or problems.

Overall, "BATTLETECH" seems a pretty good interpretations of the tabletop.  Enjoying, still learning.  Looking forward to picking up the DLC.

Things Terraria DOESNT have:

Game-breaking bugs
Split-screen
A story mode (the game has a strength-based progression though - you wont be able to defeat the stronger enemies without crafting or finding better gear, which sets you up for a "level" system completely based on your own skill, and of course luck.
Endless worlds. They are created before you enter them, so they DO have a finite size. They are usually very large, though.


Recommendations: Find a good friend/girlfriend/boyfriend/sibling/parent or three to play with this. Learning the game is the most fun part of the experience, and that experience is not only best shared - it makes getting the hang of things a lot easier, as well as exploring a lot more fun.

You like roleplaying? Terraria is good for that.

You like not dying? Better get ready to play your extreme best, in that case. This is the dark souls of 2D games.

To call Terraria 2D Minecraft is to do it an injustice. Terraria has sucessfully crafted its own style of gameplay, combining voxel style worlds with fun and enjoyable rpg elements. The biomes of the world each have their own enemies, blocks, and loot, while each retaining unique components that set each biome apart. The world itself it chock full of caves and other places to explore, whether it be deep in the jungle or a frozen cave. To keep this review organized, I will separate Terraria into three distinct periods: Pre-Hardmode, Hardmode, and Post-Plantera.
Pre-Hardmode is how each player begins the game. Exploring the world is always a treat, with each new world yielding new loot and territory to discover. Players either begin with a Corruption biome, or a Crimson Biome. However, these are not simply a reskin, as both biomes have different gear and enemies to fight. Finding all the NPC's is a stangely addictive task, and one which I enjoy quite tremendously. Building houses and making your own town from the ground up is extremely satisfying. Once players become strong enough, they can take on a series of bosses to reward them with cool loot, as well as game progression. One major point is after you defeat Skeletron, you can explore the labyrinth of the Dungeon, searching for epic loot. Finally, the final boss of Pre-Hardmode is the Wall of Flesh.
Once entering hardmode, the game manages to re-invigorate the world; each new biome now has new enemies and loot, and the Hallowed biome offers an almost fairy-tale esque enviroment to the game. Dont let the bright colors fool you though, because just about everything that doesnt want to be your friend wants to kill you. Hardmode brings a huge new variety of weapons, magic, bosses, and enviroments to explore, all leading up to the confrontation with the plant monster Plantera.
After defeating Plantera, the game enters its final stage. Once again, the biomes are beefed up, forcing you to continue to seek new gear and weapons, beating special events, and finally completing that sword collection you have been working so hard on.
All in all, Terraria has so much content and stuff to do, that I cant possibly cover it all in one review. It is one of the funnest games I have ever played, and is money extremely well spent. I would recommend it to anybody who likes to play video games.

The game is just wow

i got it for free when they gave away the 5 million copies. At first i was going awe yeah PAYDAY2 i finially got it and then it turned down for the worst.

here are my pros:
- great weapons
- great accessories
- great missions

and now my cons about the game
- no matter what difficulty you are on, police assaults are absoleutly hell, maybe even worse than hell honestly.
- bullets will hit the people you intend to kill but for some odd reason do no damage.
- when you think you have taken out a squad of police officers, somehow they can quickly respawn in the same room and blow the living tarts out of you.
- you cannot do anything in solo mode; it should be called suicide mode honestly.
- you need a group of competent players to even get the objective completed.
- when police assaults end you literally have 30 seconds to fix anything and everything.
- sometimes when your shooting someone you'll wonder why they aern't dying after you pumped 50 bullets into him and realize that your ai team that you have are literally sitting inside you absorbing the shots.
- even when your playing in solo mode you have 3 ai team mates; two that will shoot on site and just one random idiot that will just sit there and no ABSOLEUTLY nothing. I call that the human shield but whatever.

overall i cannot reccomend buying the game when it is not on sale either. if you do really want payday 2 in order to play with your friends, i reccomend buying it on sale when you can pick up all of the DLC for less than 15 dollars. if you choose to buy it when its not on sale youll be spending about 50- 75 dollars on a game that is already; lets face it a few years old. typically this game goes on sale during march and the steam summer sale. THATS IT! when it is on sale however, it can be a good pickup if you like difficult first person shooters when it is on sale that is....

overall my mind is not entierly made up on this game. Yes i selected it as not reccomended because its not a good deal for what your getting when its not on sale. some game mechanics need to be polished and fixed as well. once the developers work out the bugs and figure out what can honestly make it better, the ill more than happy to reccomend this as a good buy. other than that, its honestly your opinion what you do with your money and what you like and dislike.

If you are coming here from XCOM 1, you will feel scammed. Don't waste your money, not even on a sale. THIS IS A SCAM. I can't think of any better example of a waste of potential than Wolcen to compare XCOM 2 to. As far as i can tell, assuming you do not use mods, this game is completely unplayable. I wish i could have my hours back, i'd rather spend those hours 

XCOM 2 is an unfinished mess. It was released five years ago as of this review, yet it feels like an early access game at its best. And during my 12 hours of gameplay, i only got to see it at it's best during a DLC mission - the main game is a buggy, crashing dumpster fire full of spazzing animations, soldiers shooting sideways and misleading UI elements. How the game can ever be considered a full release in this state is beyond me, and my deepest regret about playing it is the fact it's too late to refund it.

Spend your money on something more worthwile, such as Battle Brothers, or perhaps something more entertaining, such as source sorting garbage. Put this game in the bin and burn it.

I emphasize again, this is an un-modded review. I'm not going to bother wasting time modding something so utterly unenjoyable, that despite the fact i really liked XCOM 1. That game was very fun to play. This is not. It's a shame too, because the story is great. The gameplay is just not.

UPDATE, over 100 hours later: Hunt:showdown is now unplayable. Do not waste your money - like CS 1.6 or the original CoD MW games, the hackers almost outnumber legitimate players. The game has recieved hundreds of quality of life updates, gameplay additions and bugfixes, most good but some bad (western? Nah, we're an american action movie now. Full auto bolt action weapons, anyone?) but ultimately, the servers are now full of cheaters which leaves the multiplayer portion of the game completely unplayable.

The developers added singleplayer objectives to combat this. Yep. Rather than deal with the cheater problem, they added a singleplayer mission mode to a battle royale.

Don't even get Hunt on a sale. It's glory days are long gone, this is basically a bloated zombie trying to steal your money before they abandon it to work on their next project.

ORIGINAL, POSITIVE review, from early access:

Gifted by my friend Gardinator. Playing this game with a friend is a MUST. You miss out on 60% of the experience by playing solo. It IS possible (you can also match with strangers, which can be a very social experience as well) but having a friend with voice chat elevates the entire game.

This game is hard to categorize. I WANT to call it a battle royale because it plays very similarly to one - but at the same time it's also borderline battle arena, because it doesn't have the usual battle royale system of dropping into a map and looting gear.

The game is very polished for one being in beta. The graphics look great, gameplay is smooth and responsive, the netcode is really good for a multiplayer shooter and there are a lot of mechanics to learn and use in creative ways. The map design is AMAZING. Tons of detail everywhere, always a very large number of ways you can go through any place on the map (or approach it if that is your goal) which allows for very many playstyles.

The loot system is satisfying and fun, although the gun variety is a little lacking (as most variety comes in the form of different modifications to existing weapons) and the game could really use some mission reward-exclusive weapons that you can't unlock permanently. This would make looting a lot more interesting and deaths actually mean something other than losing a character you can replace at the click of a button.

The primary complaint that comes to mind if i were to criticize it is that the maps feel a bit empty. Too few players, way too few monsters - some matches can be walking simulator slugs.

In it's current state i'd say the game is worth buying if it's at least on a 35% sale. It asks a little much for what you get, but it really is an incredible (and unique) experience you'll remember after playing.

Gameplay is big great. Gun's are fantastic and punish you for missing shots with an appropraite prolonged reload. When you do hit though nothing feels better than when these babies are being used to excavate cowboy braincases. The melee feels amazing but the hell hounds give me conniptions. You either have to shoot them and risk giving away your posision or try using melee and tank the hits. The traits are well balanced and are primarily PvE focused, which is a good thing because it keeps the PvP nice and balenced. 

The monsters make my dick curl back into my body. Especially the butcher when he gets to thump thump thumping right behind you and dont get me started on the the movements of the spider. Haven't yet encountered a glitch but have gotten a one or two server disconnects but they were no big deal. 

Overall, This has so far been extremely fun. Could use more cowboy lovin.
~Grant MacDonald

Прежде чем прочитать этот подробнейший комментарий, сначала посмотрите на размер данного текса (вашего члена) и спросите себя, можете ли вы воспринимать информацию в таком количестве.
 Про Hunt Showdown я узнал из журнала, причём не игрового, но никому абсолютно эта история не интересна.
 Я не понял, на какую кнопку включается голосовой чат. В настройках что-то есть по этому поводу, но я не нашёл внятного ответа на свой чётко поставленный вопрос. Это сильно помешало общению с другими игроками. Хотя там вообще никто не общался. Может, здесь нет голосового чата и вообще какого-либо чата. Но главное, что в эту игру заходят не пидорасы. Вот я умер по неопытности и думал уже всё, конец. Появилась надпись, что ваш напарник может вас воскресить. И мой напарник, совершенно не знакомый человек, сделал это. Правда, потом я опять умер, зато нашёл улику и хоть немного разобрался, как играть.
 Играл с низкими настройками графики по совету профессиональных геймеров. Не стал рисковать и менять на высокие, потому что оптимизация не очень. К графону у меня претензий нет, хотя он наверно и не лучший. 
 Дело в том, что насладиться действительно красивой картинкой могут далеко не все. А именно – у кого капитулятор нормальный. Гневные отзывы пишут те, кто скорее всего даже одним глазком не взглядывали на минимальные системные требования. Запускают на вёдрах, а потом жалуются – графон говно, говорят, больше сюда никогда не зайдут, что не взяли бы игру даже за бесплатно. У меня всё ровно, без лагов шло. 40 фпс. А у моего друга очень плохо. Игра долго грузилась на самых минимальных настройках, без сглаживания, потом чёрный экран и вылет. Причём он сказал, что у него выглядит всё, как в майнкрафте и спросил, почему такой плохой графон, что для меня дико странно, потому что я считаю, что он очень хорош. Я бы хотел сказать, что норм оптимизация, но такие игры создаются, чтобы играть с друзьями, а такая возможность мне не представилась.
 Перед игрой тебя заставляют нанять наёмника на твои скромные 3000 бакинских рублей. Это очень необычно и зашло мне. Из любого оружия приятно стрелять. Мне вот сильно понравилось метать керосиновую лампу во врагов. Как же красиво горит. К слову, все спецэффекты в этой игре выполнены на высшем уровне. 
 Чудовища интересные и разнообразные, отличаются от других игр. Они способны доставить дискомфорт, и их не скучно изучать. Пока. По сути сейчас есть огромная карта и одни и те же враги на ней. Надеюсь, потом разработчики будут добавлять всё новые виды врагов, новые режимы. Но они на самом деле работают над игрой, и это большой плюс. В живых мертвецов приятно стрелять, но после приземления на землю, лишённые головы, они через секунду пропадают, оставляя за собой только лужу крови. Я понимаю, для чего это сделано. И так у всех компы дымятся. Но всё равно некрасиво. Какие-то заскриптованные трупы лежат давно гниют, мухи летают. А свежее тело и минуты не задерживается. 
 Звуки. Они в Hunt Showdown восхитительны. Это наверно самая сильная сторона игры. И музыка в главном меню прекрасна, и хруст стекла, каждый шорох. А какой сладкий звук от попадания в голову! В звучании я бы ничего не менял.
 Любопытное время и место действия выбрано. Видно, что разрабы потрудились. Конечно, пушки тут ускорены и упрощены, но это и есть адаптация времени для игры. Охота Разборки довольно атмосферная, звуки делают своё дело. 
 Разработчики сказали, что игра пока в раннем доступе, и потом цена скорее всего поднимется. Так что если брать, то по скидке и как можно раньше. Crytek всё время развивает своё творение, потом возможно это окупится.  
 Ну и некоторые ошибки. Когда только зашли в игру с товарищем, у него сломалась шея, голова смотрела не в ту сторону. Не знаю, почему такое происходит, но думаю, этого можно было избежать. И самый большой косяк, который мне лично не особо мешал, - это отражения. Воды на карте много. Ты мышкой вниз ведёшь – опа! всё побелело. Поднимаешь – красивое отражение. Водная гладь вообще не знаю из чего сделана. Когда по ней бьёшь топором, от неё не идут разводы, а звук, словно долбишь по камню. 
 Короче я ещё поиграю в бесплатные выходные, но, конечно же, не куплю.
 8/10

[spoilers]Beim ersten mal durchspieln ist man enttäuscht weil man denkt das Spiel ist zu kurz, man braucht für das erste und längste ending A ca 20 stunden. In der zweite runde, also ending B spielt man den männlichen Charakter 9S das kann auch ganz schön für unzufriedenheit sorgen weil man lieber ausschlißlich 2B und A2 spielen will, und 9S mit seiner "Haking" Fähigkeit ein aufgezwungenes Minispiel mitbringt das nichts mit Hack-and-Slash zu tun hat und ziemlich auf den Keks gehen kann. Dannach folgen 3 "true" endings. ending A,B,C,D und E erzählen die main story. Dann gibt es noch 20 weitere "mission fail" endings, die als kleine gags engebaut wurden. Und dann gibt es noch ending Y wenn man den Endgegner Emil lv99 besiegt. Wer das DLC kauft kann sich auch auf 3 Arenen mit extra Gegnern freuen, die versprochenen Outfits kriegt man nicht einfachso sondern muss sie erst in der Arena gewinnen :) [/spolers]

For Honor is EXTREMELY hardcore (and primarily pvp oriented.) Overwatch/Team fortress 2 meets Mount & Blade Warband and Street Fighter / Tekken - you choose between a bunch of unique heroes (medieval warriors) that each have unique, very hard to master combos and special attacks. 

If you enjoy the pvp in games like Mount & Blade, War of the Roses, Dark souls or Absolver, you are GOING TO love this one. 

If you are not a patient person but you expect to breeze through the game by using an overpowered weapon (cough call of duty cough battlefield cough rainbow six) then you should probably steer clear of this game. It is VERY challenging and requires quite a bit of practice and reflexes to do well. Every strategy can be countered, every attack can be interrupted or even turned around - provided you figure out how. Naturally some classes will be easier than others, but none of the heroes are "bad". Some are just harder to succeed with than others.

You are competing against other people just like you, each doing their best to master their favourite hero(es) and figure out how to beat you into the dirt with them. If you're not the kind of person with the patience for this sort of competition this game is gonna piss you off and you're gonna leave a negative review complaining about "meta" and "viable" heroes. 

There are a TON of unlocks just for leveling up with a hero - you'll typically level up every few matches (however short) and chances are you'll even feel overwhelmed by the amount of equipment (and customization) you unlock - because there's something new for practically every single level up. This way there is also some sense of progression - as you level up with a hero, you'll also get more powerful effects attached to your gear and subsequently face higher leveled opponents. 

As with any hero/class system, expect to see some heroes picked a lot and others barely played at all. If you enjoy a hero and put in the time to learn how to play them, then you can succeed with literally any one of them - but even though Ubisoft typically patches the game at least once a week, some heroes will always seem "overpowered" due to their design - typically attacks that are very easy to access and very hard to play against. This does not mean any heroes are bad - some are just hard to learn, but once you do can be straight up oppressive to play against.

The game operates on a "grind to unlock" or microtransaction shit system. Fortunately, you can play the game just fine without paying a single penny beyond initial purchase. It's not quite on the level of chinese pay2win, but unfortunately you'll still have to grind quite a lot if you want to unlock stuff in the beginning. Fortunately, once you find a hero you like chances are you wont really want to play any others beyond trying them out. Every match plays out differently because every single player plays different from the others, as such matches rarely get repetitive, similar to games like League of Legends and Dota 2.

Matches typically play out in around 10 minutes (20-30 for the new game mode, Breach) and the game typically flows quickly and naturally - there's rarely any time where you have time to stop for a breather, or won't have any clue what you should do.

Got the starter pack for free. I didn't play much but the game is fairly stable and pretty fun. 

Except the P2P complain that has been addressed I don't really get the current hate...

People complaining they are getting ganked just don't understand the logic of the game. It's like this in any game. Stick with your team, redeploy, and avoid rushing 1vs3. And if things get sour, just retreat. If your team isn't too bad they'll either come to back up, either they will take the opportunity to go for objectives.

People talking about glitches are also in bad faith. There can be some but just avoid them.

I didn't play much but for the small experience I have, for a free game it certainly is a good game.

Unfortunately me and my friends have little time to play but playing with your friends must be a blast

一款被网络毁了的神作，评价分为两部分吧，单机篇和联机篇。
在单人游戏方面完全不用到新FH像R6S那样基本没单人，FH的单人剧情做的很好，骑士维京武士三方势力各有独特且向互联系的剧情，剧情战役长度足够玩很长一段时间了，至少我觉得免费周的一百多元就是光玩单人也值了，这是一种跟骑砍老滚巫师3截然不同的冷兵器战斗体验。
在多人游戏方面，如果刨去服务器的话，多人玩玩是很有意思的，但实话说这款游戏网络要是不改善的话，多人玩着真的很难受，载入慢，无限加载，更可怕的是玩玩突然掉线，补充一下这都是我开着加速器碰到的问题，至于不开加速器，像R6S一样裸连，恐怕真伤不起。
其他方面比如气氛，挑衅的骂街的个人感觉比R6S少（都是育碧的就拿这俩做比较了），技术方面得下一番功夫慢慢练，每个英雄在控制上都有差别，想要做到收放自如的话，没太多的练习肯定是不成的。
最后衷心希望土豆能尽快改善这个熟透了的服务器。
游戏是好游戏，但是土豆服务器质量真是让人无语，处决，重连，掉线，一气呵成。土豆里的豪杰，什么时候服务器就好了就改回来好评

app_name: Ni no Kuni™ II: Revenant Kingdom
review:
剧情感觉很平淡
玩起来还是不错了
第一个全成就的游戏（然后更新又出了两个新成就，真坑）

first ten matches: ok what am i doing... ohh papayas.,.. cool.... oh shit what up stranger.... i can't open anything.... HOW DOES HE HAVE A GUN WTF???....  oh shit a flare gun, oh shit free loot.... 

after those first ten or so matches of experiencing the game you start realizing that it really isn't worth $30.0 usd. I think the barebones of the concept is great, but their implementation of it is horrid. The gunpay is lacking, the PVE is lacking, monsters are predictable. This big ass island and you only have 3 different mobs to deal with which are just the same mob with different colors. if you can rush and find a gun before everyone else, you can practically hunt everyone else and kill them. Don't find anyone early? spend the rest of your time running around and island to die to people with guns. Getting the shard is more of spending the time to kill it then actually hard, while i do like that you can't really get it alone, it forces you to attempt to work with someone else. Idk, its lacking way too much content for it to be justifiable. You only really need to be in a team to complete 1 task, thats it, and its not even a riddle, its not even hard, you just need one to tank and the other to attack, other than that once you have a shard, you don't need anyone anymore, kill them go find a flare gun end game. if this game had multiple layers of rewarding grouping/ungrouping and forcing people into situations where they need to either team up or break up from the team, or even multiplayer riddles, or anything you can think of to force a dialogue, then maybe it will be worth it, but otherwise with the lack of content in the game i highly doubt that's possible, They would have to implement a bunch of new stuff. Also the viewership emotes are corny as hell. With or without toxic developers, the game itself is lacking so much to justify paying 30.0 usd. Buy it if you want to have a "new experience for the first 5-10 matches" but after that, unless you really love this game, you'll get pretty bored.

If there's one thing i regret about this purchase, it's that i didn't make it sooner. 

SHORT REVIEW:

Beautiful, beautiful graphics and animations. Super cute player character. Catchy music that doesn't get old, reminiscent of Towerfall Ascension's soundtrack. Straightforward gameplay, easy to learn but hard to master, satisfying and responsive. Lots of unique enemies. 

The story is both well-written, detailed, deep and quite dark. Reminiscient of Final Fantasy 7 (The original - i haven't played the remake)

I can't get over all the little details in the animations - these pixels are more expressive than most people! Absolutely gorgeous visuals that always surprise with their incredible amount of detail.

DETAILED REVIEW:


Where do i even start? The art is FANTASTIC. Despite being pixel art, it's so detailed (and so extremely well and fluidly animated) that you can make out anything from how your character (which is absolutely adorable, by the way!) jumps in different manners based on how fast you are moving, to how her cheeks puff out when you're holding your breath! Adorable, adorable pixels... And sometimes oddly sexy, which is confused me at first due to the overall look of the world. It seemed out of place, but only at first glance, before i learnt more of the story.

Don't let the appearances decieve you. There is a LOT more depth to this than i thought at first glance - i'd never imagine the story, and it's characters, would be so interesting. There is a lot of depth to all of the main characters that appear. I am barely four hours in (without a break, unusual but this game just keeps me going) and there has already been several twists and turns i'd never imagine. 

There is a lot of originality here. It's very refreshing.

Besides the breathtaking graphics, the music is also outstanding. You never really get tired of the ambience or the atmospheric music constantly playing in the background - all the sounds work extremely well to draw you into the experience. Also, did i mention your adorable player character also has adorable music notes for footsteps? And Kirby-esque sound effects for jumps!

If you like true metroidvanias, you are going to LOVE this. Unlike others of its kind, there is hardly any backtracking - you'll only ever really have to backtrack if you get lost, and there's always a map available for you to use should you need it.

Character interactions play out really well, with great writing (and translation) as well as extremely lifelike expressions and gestures. I've never experienced anything like it before from pixel art.

畫風可愛，用色明亮，全程語音，新增宿屋同伴對話。放了一年多Bug也更新掉，現在也有中文，要買算可以買了，當然，等打折。但如果不懷舊，沒玩過原作或是原作不能接受者，或者想要拿全成就的，還是別碰了。

音源有原音跟新編，戰鬥模式更應該有。但沒有！
非常老式的戰鬥節奏都還原了，現在的玩家應該很難理解在玩三小。
遊玩過程非常拖延，劇情全過，包括不跳對話聽語音應該不用十小時。

而我總遊戲時數四十小時主要還是拚全成就，剩餘的時間大多是很枯燥的練法術熟練度，跟最後兩個迷宮刷怪物掉落，這個過程加上法術演出、戰鬥演出，堪稱災難。怪物光死亡動畫就可以拖3秒，不使用月魔法強化致命一擊容易MISS，強化致命一擊怪物被擊飛演出會拖時間；施展魔法會卡演出，怪物被魔法打也會卡演出，優化不好讀取過場慢，那怕後來練功到怪物差不多一刀殺了，也要被演出跟讀取拖很久。

然後熟練度設計雖然有動畫變化，但是本身成長曲線的設計就有問題，不刻意找補給點反覆施放混熟練度，就算是普莉姆常用的水魔法治療從頭補到尾，我估計最多等級到5，後期那個放一次魔法2%、1%的設計根本有病，一個角色還七種魔法，全部都要從頭練到8完全就是當年娛樂少，沒其他遊戲可以選的病態設計。

而且說實在，練上去除了成就，跟看稍微不一樣的動畫外，過關其實用不到那麼高等的法術，練上來非常空虛。

但在還原上是真的很還原，這點我真不知道怎麼說……
玩完我個人心情是很複雜的，勉強還是給推薦，但只推薦知道這些缺點還能接受的人。

so finally Vert got a Game too now, even if Neptune is still the main heroine :3 Well if youre Neptune fan you will love it, non fans cant enjoy this since its plain fanservice :3

If you think neptunia games are absolutely dumb than its absolutely true for you. But if you love those girls and this type of humor you gonna have a great time for sure <3

First things first, this game is worth buying.  Yes the game lasts about 3hrs from start to finish but you do have the option to replay (which you will instinctively find yourself doing).

Not a big 2D style gamer but it was on sale ($7.49) and the artwork looked amazing (which it definitely is).

Right off the bat they show you a couple keyboard instructions but then thats it.  Your struggle begins figuring out how the ship and the world works as you press forward.  Super simple concept, just keep going.
What these devs have managed to do in those three hours is manipulate your emotions as you get sucked into this game.   The music is right on cue with whats happening in the world and you become connected to your little person and the ship.  You find yourself alone with no idea whats really going or how you came to be, all you know is you gotta keep the ship moving.
This game is right on the same level as Frost Punk when it comes to becoming attached and feeling the characters struggle.  Come on little buddy you got this.

Again the gameplay lasts about 3hrs and although that seems short, I'd definitely recommend
Fun for group, sucks for solo. Good mechanics, very easy on eyes. Would recomend, 8/10

I'm kinda torn...

The game is incredibly fun, which is a breath of fresh air in todays market, but it does have a number of issues, these include server issues (the only server which works in NA_WEST, not ideal if like me you're not playing in the US), there is a major lack of players, frequent disconnects & some bugs that need fixing which can't be excused by this game being a "parody" (such as not being able to quit the shooting range)

Some improvements i'd like to see would be the inclusion of obvious bots to bolster servers if a player count is not reached once a certain amount of time passes, the inclusion of bots could also be used for a single player "practice" mode, various performance improvements, auto select of nearest server, less fog / improved visability & even more silliness.

All that being said, It only cost £4, about the price of an oven pizza & the first game was so funny it made made it worth the money so i'd still recommend it just for the giggles or to aid weight loss if like me you bought it instead of a pizza!.. :D

Got this game free in the first 100 hours. Blatantly better than the games it's parodying because it doesn't take itself too seriously while still being fun and hilariously frustrating to play.

Has a surprising amount of features. Doesn't need advanced cover systems, vaulting, or climbing, since the floppy sausage physics system allows you to do all of those things through normal movement. Want weapon mods? You got 'em. Put em on anthing. Scoped blunderbuss? Silenced minigun? OK. It's even got dual-wielding. And you can hold any gun gangsta-style, though it's not always a good idea.

Aiming is incredibly hard due to high recoil and complete lack of reticle, but since everyone has the same handicap it goes all the way past frustrating to being hilarious and an enjoyable aspect of the game's jank.

Here you can run with ak 47 while being dressed like some sort of Gandalf wannabe. It's very fun BR. Shooting is good and all other mechanics that you're used to in BR's are there... it's just ... you're a wobbly physics weirdo. It's good stuff. I recommend.

One of the better story-focused games after 2010, a proper 3D metroidvania exploration game with decent souls-like combat and riveting writing & voice acting. The game is beautiful both visually and musically, and it all sets the theme for the game as a whole from start to finish.

It took me nearly 50 hours to finish one playthrough, but i am notoriously slow-paced and like to explore everything. There are multiple endings seeing as there are possibly around 100 unique choices you can make to subtly influence the game world and the story, but i don't want to explore the others - i made the choices that felt right for me and i'll leave it at that.

永远忘不掉2017年1月，第一次云通关如龙0的那个时候，那是我第一次真正了解到如龙这个ip。热血、中二又时而悲壮的剧情，极具特色的极道之间赤手空拳的act战斗模式，以及绚丽的都市景色，都深深吸引了我。无奈因为家里的限制，无法购得ps4，于是只能遗憾地当个云玩家。不过后来听说如龙移植pc的时候真的是非常非常非常惊喜，日盼夜盼能早点玩到，为了补票在游戏刚放出来的时候就二话不说直接预购了，算是尽我所能补偿曾经的遗憾。
如龙0作为如龙系列第一款有官中的作品，得以在发售后被国内玩家熟知，很多现今的如龙玩家都是0代入坑，不过很多老玩家眼里如龙0并不是那么完美。
就我本人而言，我的观点可能比较折中。
首先从战斗系统来看，如龙0沿袭如龙维新的多战斗风格切换制，如果参透战斗系统可以打出很华丽的连击，不过如龙0的战斗系统也算是整个系列里最烂的……各种数值崩坏，敌人各种霸体转身，以及部分战斗风格设计过于强大，导致如龙0的难度几乎是如龙系列最低的一作，不太需要吃技术。但也正因如此，这种过于强大的属性也能在打群架的时候体验到前所未有的不需要思考太多的爽感。
再说说剧情，横山的剧本虽然充斥着中二里切基佬，也经常有一些不合常理的地方，然后这样的日式热血中二却十分合乎我的胃口。0代的剧情在我心中是整个系列的前排——桐生线的友情，真岛线的爱情，都给我留下了很深的印象，也难得我在看到游戏结尾的时候情不自禁就潸然泪下……即便很多人对横皮尔博格的剧情不是很满意，但我总是愿意去接受他给我们带来的极道的故事。再复杂的问题，脱下衣服，用拳头干一架就完事了！
总而言之，就如龙0游戏内容的份量，在pc上遇到打折时候购买，绝对是血赚，除了主线剧情外，经营金钱岛，风化岛，上街打打麻将，打打扑克牌，去食品店吃个饭啥的等等，完完全全可以当做日本街头生活模拟器来玩，主线的肃敛与支线的沙雕结合造就了一个完全的如龙世界，让玩家在进行沉重的主线同时又能体验到支线的快乐。如果龙组经济不景气，可以考虑把剩下几代包括外传都移植到pc上来，我相信有很多人愿意买账的……最后祝愿如龙这个系列能一直走下去！
For £15 in the UK, this game is more than worth it.

Подошёл к процессу ответственно, начав читать Вархаммер. Не могу сказать что это сильно помогло в принятии внутриигровых решений, но зато поролеплеил :) В целом и без знания вархаммеровских произведений будет играться на ура. 

Касательно игры: 

Геймплейно может слегка поднадоесть ближе к концу, но интерес хорошо поддерживает постоянное обновление билдов и прокачка адептов, а так же большая вариативность противников.

Баланс:
1) Хромает, и если хочется сложностей, лучше брать сложность "Очень тяжело", случайное взятие талантов адептами механикус и по одной пушке в каждые руки. Вот тогда получится прочувствовать превозмогание. 2) Боссы не становятся сильнее со временем, что уменьшает интерес если подходить к ним ближе к концу игры. Половина боссов пролетается без особого интереса, но есть интересные субьекты с точки зрения левелдизайна и тому что нужен определенный подход к прохождению таковых. 

UI: 
1) Сложность заданий не скаллируется. Возможно задавалась руками, и задания против Ксенаритов с пометкой "Просто", действительно, просто разделают вас на колбасу) Однажды отобразившись задание как "сложное", никогда не пересчитает сложность для игрока - оно навсегда остаётся отображаться как сложное, хотя по факту будет изи бризи.
2) Экипировку вражеских юнитов(ксенаритов) посмотреть удаётся только наведя на его портрет на шкале инициативы. Увидеть - можно, прочитать что этот эквип делает - нет. Странно, но ладно.
3) Если бы не подсказка друга, что есть отдельная категория заданий, которая вызывается на ПРОБЕЛ в меню выбора заданий - я бы в жизни не догадался и пропустил бы плюс минус интересный нарративный кусок игры, не говоря уже об необходимой экипировке. Зачем так сделано - загадка.
В остальном полный порядок.

Левелдизайн:
Неплохо. Жаль в концу игры "арены" начинают повторяться.

Музыка и звуки божественны! Нет какой то особой вариативности, но даже то что есть отлично вписалось и о ужас - слушаешь этот саундтрек не напрягаясь на протяжении 30 часов.
Top Spiel

Darksiders 3 is a very good action adventure game, with gameplay, a story and worldbuilding akin to the classics of the PS2 era - Jak & daxter, Ratchet & clank, Castlevania, Devil may cry etc. I can't think of any other game released after 2010 that made me feel the same way these games did.

Music is practically nonexistent, but the visuals are pretty good and animations are very fluid. The combat is for the most part very fluid and responsive, with a clever combo system that lets you learn and master it as you play through the game, never really getting monotonous or repetitive.

My only real complaints would be that the game engine seems to struggle with large scenes, and that sometimes it can skip button inputs when a lot of enemies are attacking at the same time. There are no consequences for dying unless you play on the permadeath difficulty, so it's not really a problem on the default game modes.

app_name: Mutant Year Zero: Road to Eden
review: Годно.

app_name: Mutant Year Zero: Road to Eden
review:
Пробежалась за 17 часов на Сложном уровне сложности.
Оценил бы своим зажравшимся на тактические игры взглядом на 7.5/10, и вот почему: 

Визуально  полный порядок - VFX эффекты, локации, парралакс катсцены, анимации.... Бросается в глаза только контраст между персонажами нарисованными и персонажами замоделенными - (Некоторые, особенно не фури-мутанты) выглядят довольно "чучельно".

Аудиально тоже всё отлично - музыка и саундэффекты очень органично смотрятся в происходящем.

Подача лора через окружение, записки, описание предметов и диалоги - 11 шакалов из 10. Невероятно! Сюжетный твист...просто хороший :)

Что подкачало:

Массовый реюз и низкая уникальность способностей между персонажей, и оттого нехватка тактического пространства для манёвров. Не хватает уникальных способностей/оружия с уникальными механиками.

Спорный момент насчет того что приходится часто выходить в меню персонажей и переключать свои активные/пассивные способности в зависимости от того зачищаешь ли ты локацию по стелсу или ввязываешься в бойню.

Порой наличие странных прострелов сквозь стены, которое может здорово насолить тем игрокам, который любят страдать на Immortal Ironman сложностях в подобного жанра играх.

И самое сладкое - "рандом", который считается не в момент выстрела, а между ними. Иначе говоря при промахе с шансом попадания в 75%, сколько не перезагружайся, всё равно будет промах.

How can i summarize Nioh in a few words? I'll compare it to it's most famous relative, Dark souls.

Once you've played Nioh, you'll never be able to fully enjoy Dark souls again. It'll always feel lacking. Nioh has by far the most cinematic combat i've ever experienced in any game - even more so that Monster Hunter World and The Witcher 3. The graphics are beautiful and battles are extremely fluid.

Nioh is, essentially, what would happen if Way of the Samurai and the diablo series met Dark souls. The randomized gear resembles games like Diablo 3 and Path of Exile, while the loot system itself is reminiscient of Monster Hunter. Enemies can drop all sorts of gear (more likely to be gear it is or could potentially wield) but they ALSO drop unique items tied to their specific type or class.

The further you progress in the game, the more it opens up and the deeper it gets. There is a ton of lore, a ton of gear, a ton of mechanics, a ton of techniques, a ton of combinations - and i dont think i am even halfway through the game yet. The longer i play the more i discover.

I won't throw any spoilers - but this game is both much, much harder than Dark souls - and much, much deeper. Beware however - this also means it can be a lot more confusing and frustrating, because you have to do A LOT of thinking to fully be able to make use of the complex gear / stat system, and all the possible ways you can build your playstyle from your equipped items.

This is a fantastic game if you enjoy games that combine grinding, freedom of leveling, complex skill trees with techniques (like a dumbed-down Street Fighter or Tekken) with extremely unforgiving combat that rewards you for quick thinking, learning and adapting on the move as well as punishing your opponents' mistakes.

The game features co-op akin to Dark souls as well as a PvP game mode i have yet to explore - i'll update my guide once i try the multiplayer and see what it's like. I can however confirm the game does have multiplayer factions - similar to Dark souls covenants - with very diverse stat bonuses depending on which you select, and the freedom to change choice frequently. Nothing is permanent in this game - there is always a way back if you regret your decisions.

All in all, this game only keeps impressing the further i get into it - where i thought this would be a streamlined story experience i could finish in fifty hours or less, i now realize i might invest hundreds of hours in it without seeing everything it has to offer - and hopefully without getting tired of it.

Do i recommend this game? Yes. Hell yes. When it comes to samurai games, this is by far one of the best out there.

This game is a great action sandbox. There's very little more to say about it, except that it's much more light-hearted and casual (fun to play vs effort to enjoy) than similar games like GTA or Saints row.

Great music. Fun physics sandbox that you can exploit thanks to the awesome grappling hook with tether claws you can attach to stuff.

Movement is extremely agile and responsive, and there's a wingsuit that lets you fly very far very fast.

It doesn't have traditional shooter mechanics like crouching or cover, oddly enough. It compensates for this by letting you take an ungodly amount of hits before you are actually in any danger. Besides, there's rarely a need for cover once you figure out how to quickly and efficiently use the grappling hook to be everywhere at once during firefights.

Excellent game!

For a fraction of price of AAA title like Civ 6 you get much more enjoyable game.  Heck, I got it on sale for a price of a movie ticket, and already had 20+ hours of awesome gaming experience.

Now, the game itself... It is a bit like simplified AOE or Civ in real-time, but simplified doesn't mean bad here - it means the game doesn't overwhelm you with hundreds of stats and mechanics, allowing to maintain focus on every small detail. In fact, it is all about small details. All the limitations are to make you constantly chose what's more important, what to focus on. 

It is also much more about maintaining healthy ecomony than waging wars. Indeed, the amount of fighting units may seem very limited to some, but then again, it is not a wargame, fighting does happen, but its not the focal point of the game.

Music, sound, art - everything is very well done, feels solid. Music especially, it sets the mood really well, the only complaint is that maybe there could be a bit more variety.

Campaing was good, challenging enough, and did a good job explaining all you need to know about mechanics and gameplay.

I have yet to try multiplayer, so can't comment on that, but single player experience is already good enough to recommend it.

К сожалению 30 часов игры мне не хватило даже на то, чтобы дойти до мастера душ.
Либо дело в моей криворукости и отсутствии опыта игры в платформеры, либо из-за неизменных 20 фпс в любой игре, запущенной на моем компьютере.
Но даже этого мне хватило для того чтобы оценить всю прелесть этого мира.
Лично я досмотрел весь не увиденный контент на ютубе.

P.S. при первом прохождении не повторяйте моей ошибки: НИКОГДА не заходите на вики. Вы проспойлерите кучу всего просто пытаясь найти куда дальше идти.

if i had to choose it would be a thumbs down but since theres no other sim like this ill give it a thumbs up.
heres the catch of this game you start with about 10 - 15 planes and install freeware and/or buy payware planes via forums. i dont think that its worth 60 bucks and the average cost of a payware plane is 5 - 20 dollars 5 dollars being a OK plane 10 dollars being a better plane 15 dollars being a good plane and 20 is like really good. the scenery is odd so cities like las vegas have realistic scenery but the scenery bugs a lot like for example the golden gate bridge has floating cars also xplane has a like some kind of house system so you could be in the suburbs of miami and see one house and you go to the suburbs of dallas and you find the exact same house. now dont let the trailer and those youtubers scenery and all those planes they got trick you they have atleast 3 scenery mods like airport enviroment sattlelite scenery and a misterx airport made better scenery mod. the planes they have they spent like more than likely more than $50 on planes. this game is not in my favors i would get fsx cause you start with many planes.

DEAD GAME - AVOID AT ALL COSTS: Nobody playing. Takes ages to launch a map.

And rightfully so it's a dead game...


40EUR is a DEMANDING Price you either need good quality or good quantity. Both of which this game doesn't have.... 

- No variety in the maps: all maps are barely the same: flat bocage with a village here and there.
- very few maps
- very few factions
- NO MAP EDITOR!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
- only two super boring multiplayer game modes: Destruction (total campfest) and Conquest (ends too quickly)
- nobody to play with.... Wait half an hour to start a game, play for 20 minutes.... Jesus... Even if I was paid to play this game I wouldn't do it...


And they dare releasing DLC with extra Divisions??? Hey guys? Are you stupid or what?

Add maps since you BLOCKED MAP EDITING YOU BASTARDS.
Add game modes
Add factions

Instead of trying to milk the thin player base releasing useless DLC with new factions?

I'm never going to buy one of your games again. This is probably my biggest gaming purchase regret...

Best VR game I ever played, All other games are a lot less fun now. Notting compares to the immersion and quality of life of HL: Alyx.

where to start great visuals great story now is the time to buy steam VR. This game pushes the boundaries into true VR sensitivity adding new depth with the steam VR controllers. If steam VR was not so costly I think everyone would be playing this game. and hopefully some new games with similar mechanics will come out.

Impressive VR game. Some design choices are aimed to the newcomers of this technology and experts could feel a bit annoyed: for instance I prefer free locomotion but if you need to run during a gunfight, the speed of the sprint will not be enough and you will find yourself using the teleportation.
If you are a fan of the saga you must have this game and experience it, especially the ending that really gave me goosebumps.
